p: Eucalyptus forests are the largest cultivated and natural hardwood flora worldwide, a genus belonging to the Myrtaceae family [ 58] ( Figure 4). Eucalyptus genus includes more than 700 species distributed around the world [ 59]. For example, Brazil [ 58], Australia [ 60], Egypt [ 61], China [ 62], Portugal, the European Union, and Spain [ 63] are the countries where Eucalyptus plantations are widely distributed in their landscapes. As a general description, the Eucalyptus genus comprises perennial and evergreen plants that vary from small shrubs to tall trees [ 64].
